intro: Tephroseris rivularis, commonly known as the riverbank tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in moist, well-drained soils near water bodies. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. It is often found in riparian zones and is adapted to periodic flooding. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners in suitable climates.
